item.title: String isn't working in the if statement
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[code] public void newWelc() {
String owner = “Mod Allstar”;
String LU = “Elemental Armor”;
String Rep = “+ reputation”;
String Name = “+ playerName”;
String Location = “”;
String Rights = “”;
if(edgeLocation()) {
Location = “Edgeville”;
} else if(varrokLocation()) {
Location = “Varrok”;
} else if(fallyLocation()) {
Location = “Fally”;
}
if(playerRights == 1) {
Rights = “Mod”;
} else if(playerRights == 2) {
Rights = “Admin”;
} else if(playerRights == 3) {
Rights = “Co-Owner”;
} else if(playerRights == 0) {
Rights = “Player”;
}
int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount();

    sendQuest("God Scape", 15950);
    sendQuest("Welcome Back", 15960);
    sendQuest("@whi@" + Name, 15961);
    sendQuest("@gre@You're a " + Rights, 15959);
    sendQuest("redPlayers: @whi@"   + players, 15951);
    sendQuest("Reputation: @whi@" + Rep, 15952);
    sendQuest("Follow the rules", 15953);
    sendQuest("Have Fun...", 15954);
    sendQuest("Game Time: @whi@" + playerGameTime, 15955);
    sendQuest("Location: @whi@" + Location, 15956);
    sendQuest("", 15957);
    sendQuest("", 15958);

    showInterface(15944);
}[/code]

Try that, also, please learn the Java Code Conventions.

Read full topic

item.title: String isn't working in the if statement
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Ok, so i have the welcome screen interface set up so that it strings your location (a boolean i made) and your rights. For some reason, it compiles the if statements successfully, but when i add custom strings for them, they get an error.

[code] public void newWelc() {

    String owner = "Mod Allstar";
    String LU = "Elemental Armor";
    String Rep =  "+ reputation";
    String Name =  "+ playerName";

if(edgeLocation()) {
String Location = “Edgeville”;
} else if(varrokLocation()) {
String Location = “Varrok”;
} else if(fallyLocation()) {
String Location = “Fally”;
}
if(playerRights == 1) {
String Rights = “Mod”;
} else if(playerRights == 2) {
String Rights = “Admin”;
} else if(playerRights == 3) {
String Rights = “Co-Owner”;
} else if(playerRights == 0) {
String Rights = “Player”;
}
int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount();

    sendQuest("God Scape", 15950);
    sendQuest("Welcome Back", 15960);
    sendQuest("@whi@" + Name, 15961);
    sendQuest("@gre@You're a " + Rights, 15959);
    sendQuest("redPlayers: @whi@"   + players, 15951);
    sendQuest("Reputation: @whi@" + Rep, 15952);
    sendQuest("Follow the rules", 15953);
    sendQuest("Have Fun...", 15954);
    sendQuest("Game Time: @whi@" + playerGameTime, 15955);
    sendQuest("Location: @whi@" + Location, 15956);
    sendQuest("", 15957);
    sendQuest("", 15958);

    showInterface(15944);
}[/code]

That’s my code.

client.java:275: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Rights location: class client sendQuest("@gre@You're a " + Rights, 15959); ^ client.java:281: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Location location: class client sendQuest("Location: @whi@" + Location, 15956); ^

That’s my error. Only two errors. It says it can’t recognize the Strings i set.

Anyone help me out? don’t avoid it if you aren’t sure, because some of the other threads i made of my errors had no replies at all. If you have any idea or guess at all, please post.

Read full topic
